solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (25 \times 11 + 11 \times 13 + 25 \times 13) = 1486 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 1.8 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(1486 \times 1.8\)
= Rs. 2674.8

content.text: Latika needs to paint a rectangular box from the outside. The cost of painting the box is Rs. 1.8 per \(cm^2.\) If the dimensions of the box are \(25 cm \times 11 cm \times 13 cm\), what is the total cost of painting the box?

solution.text:

Volume of new cuboid = \(lbh\) = Volume of cylinder
Therefore, \(lbh = 32648 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow 31 \times 25 \times h = 32648 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {32648}{31 \times 25} = 42.13\)
The new cuboid is 42.13 cm tall

solution.text:
Area of school floor \(= 4725 m^2\)
Area of each tile = \(Base \times height = 25 \times 9 = 225 cm^2\)
Since the tiles can be perfectly broken into smaller parts, the number of tiles required is the area of the floor divided by the area of each tile. Also, remember that \(1m^2 = 10000 cm^2\)
Therefore, Number of tiles = 210000

=\(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}\times 1600 cm^2\)
Therefore, volume of water added = Area of base \(\times\) Rise in water Level
=103800 \(cm^3\)
Since 1L =\(1000cm^3\)
Volume of water added = 103.8 L

content.text: The water tank in Rekha’s house has a base in the shape of an equilateral triangle with each side measuring 40 cm. It is filled with water till a height of 3 metres. She pours some more water into the tank and the new level is 4.5 metres. What volume of water did she pour into the tank? Use \(\sqrt{3} = 1.73\)

hint.text: Area of an equilateral triangle = \(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4} \times side^2\)

solution.text:
Total Curved Surface Area = \(2\pi rh = 110 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow 2rh = \frac{110}{\pi} = 35 cm^2\)
Once you cut the slice, there are three faces without icing: The curved outer surface and the two rectangular inner surfaces. (Remember that the top and bottom surfaces have icing)
Also, length of Base of Slice = Radius of Cylinder and Height of Slice = Height of Cylinder
Therefore, area of the slice that has no icing
= Curved area of slice + 2 \(\times\) Rectangular surface area of slice
\(= \frac{1}{10}\)(Total Curved Surface Area) + 2 \(\times\) (Base \(\times\) Height of slice)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 110 + 2rh\)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 110 + 35\)
= 46 \(cm^2\)

content.text: You are given a cylindrical cake with icing on the top and bottom. There is no icing on the curved surface and the curved surface area is \(110 cm^2\). You then cut a straight slice from the cake (as shown below) such that the volume of the slice is exactly \(\frac {1}{10}\) of the volume of the cake. What surface area of your slice has no icing?

hint.text: Think about your slice as a separate object. What faces do not have icing?

solution.text:
Curved surface area (CSA) = \(2\pi rh\)
Total surface area = \(2\pi r (r+h) = 2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 3 \times CSA = 1848\)
Therefore, \(2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 6\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow 2\pi r^2 = 4\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 2h\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2}\)
\(CSA = \frac{1848}3 = 2\pi rh = 2\pi r(\frac {r}{2}) = \pi r^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area of Base = \(\pi r^2 = \frac{1848}3\)
\(\Rightarrow r^2 = \frac {1848\times 7}{3\times 22}\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 14 cm\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2} = 7 cm\)
Therefore, volume \(= \pi r^2h = 4312 cm^3\)

solution.text:
Area of Polygon = Area of Triangle (1) + Area of Trapezium (2) + Area of Triangle (3) + Area of Triangle (4) + Area of Triangle (5)
\(\frac 12 \times a \times b + \frac 12 (b + e)(c + d) + \frac 12 \times e \times f + \frac 12 \times g \times (d+f) + \frac 12 \times (a+c) \times g\)
\(= \frac 12 \times 36 \times 37 + \frac 12 \times 82 \times 55 + \frac 12 \times 45 \times 27 + \frac 12 \times 36 \times 45 + \frac 12 \times 73 \times 36\)
\(=5976.5 cm^2\)

\(= \frac 12 (4.5 + 6)(3) \times 2\)
\(= 31.5 mm^2\)

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 416 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(416 m^2\)
Therefore, \(416 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{416}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{4}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 2 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

hint.text: Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2 (lb + bh + lh)\)

content.text: You have set up a rain-water harvesting system at your home. A cylindrical container with a radius of 9 dm collects rain-water from your roof. solution.text:
Volume of original tube = \((\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h)\)
\(= 5732.57 cm^3\)
Now, Volume of new tube = Volume of original tube
Let the length of the new tube be x
Therefore,\(V_ {new} = (\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h) = (\pi (\frac {10}{2})^2 \times x) - (\pi (\frac {10}{2} - 5)^2 \times x)\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \frac {V_ {original}}{\pi (\frac {10}2)^2-\pi (\frac {10}2 - m)^2}\)
= 72.96 cm

content.text: A metallic tube, 76 cm long, has a thickness of 4 cm and an outer diameter of 10 cm. It is melted and made into another tube of thickness 5 cm with the same outer diameter. No material is wasted. What is the length of the new tube?

hint.text: Since no material is wasted, the volumes of both tubes are exactly equal

solution.text:
Cross section of river area = Area of 1 + Area of 2 \(= ac \times \frac 12 (d-c) (a+b) = 140 \times 32 + \frac 12 \times 48\times(140 + 110)\)
\(= 10480 m^2\)
Rate of flow = 2 km/hr = 2000 m/hr
Volume of water flow = Area of cross section \(\times\) Rate of flow
\(= 10480 \times 2000 = 20960000 m^3/hr\)
= 20960 megalitre/hr
One week = 7 days =\( 24 \times 7\) hours = 168 hours
Therefore, volume of water flowing into the sea in one week \(= 168 \times 20960\)
= 3521280 megalitres

Therefore, the volume will quadruple

content.text: A cube has an edge measuring 16 cm. Find the number of cubes of edge 8 cm that can be cut off from it.

solution.text:
Given the volume of the pipe = V = 14095.71 \(cm^3\)
The volume of a cylindrical pipe = \(\pi{r_ o}^2h - \pi{r_ i}^2h\)
Let the thickness of the pipe be \(x\)
\(\Rightarrow V = \pi (13)^2 \times 65 - \pi (13-x)^2 \times 65\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac {V}{65\pi}=13^2 - (13-x)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow (13-x)^2 = 169 - \frac{V}{65\pi}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 13 - 10\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 3\)
Therefore, the thickness of the pipe is 3 cm

content.text: The volume of a metallic cylinder pipe is 14095.71 cubic centimetres. Its length is 65 cm and its external radius is 13 cm. Find its thickness

solution.text:
Surface Area of the pipe = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2(\pi {r_ o}^2 - \pi {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 2\pi \times \frac{30}2 \times 2 + 2 \pi \times \frac{10}2 \times 2 + 2\pi({\frac{30}2}^2 - {\frac{10}2}^2)\)
= 1508.57\(cm^2\)
Therefore, cost of painting the pipe \(= 1508.57 \times 0.2\)
= Rs. 301.71

content.text: A cylindrical pipe has an outer diameter of 30 cm and an inner diameter of 10 cm. Its length is 2 cm. It needs to be painted on its outer and inner surfaces, as well as the rims. The cost of painting the pipe is Rs. 0.2 per \(cm^2\). What is the total cost of painting the pipe?

hint.text: Surface Area of the pipe = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
